answerText: phonons[10] This quantity for phonons is usually called a "pseudo" or "crystal" version of this quantity because it is only defined modulo a reciprocal lattice vector. Just like photons, phonons have an energy given by h-bar times this quantity.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 2 | 22 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These particles are described by Bose-Einstein statistics and in diatomic crystals their dispersion relation breaks up into an acoustic and an optical mode.  [10] Identify these particles, the collective excitations of a crystal lattice.
